_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Impermanence in the Three Times [sn22.9:: Form of the past and future is impermanent
Feeling of the past and future is impermanent
Perception of the past and future is impermanent
Choices of the past and future is impermanent
Consciousness of the past and future is impermanent
What a learned noble disciple does (a ca: They don’t worry about past form
They don’t look forward to enjoying future form
They practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding present form
They don’t worry about past consciousness
They don’t look forward to enjoying future consciousness
They practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding present consciousness.
